page.title: 19Wildlife
page.content: Few wildlife habitats remain in this intensively farmed area.Untreated roadside verges are refuges for wildlife,particularly if backed by hedges and ditches.There are 2 valuable verges in this area which contain Bee Orchids and Yellow Wort(Stevington turn)and Field Cow-Wheat (Dropshort). Local woods are carpeted with bluebells in springtime.Stagsden Bird Gardens also attracts wild birds.Although the area is not ideal suited to Barn Owls,who need permanent grass and open ground to hunt-pairs have been bred at the Gardens and found homes in nearby farms.Locally there Muntjac deer, Badgers, foxes, stoats and weasels.
